intro: Linanthus bellus, commonly known as the pretty linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
